{{Use mdy dates|date=March 2014}} {{Update|inaccurate=yes|date=July 2011}} {{Infobox Organization |name = 350.org |image = 350 organisation logo.svg |image_border = |size = |abbreviation = |motto = |formation = {{start date and age|df=yes|2007}} |extinction = |type = NGO |status = |purpose = cut CO<sub>2</sub> emissions and build a global movement for climate solutions |headquarters = [[Oakland, California]] |location = |membership = |leader_title = Founders |leader_name = [[Bill McKibben]], Phil Aroneanu, Will Bates, Kelly Blynn, May Boeve, Jamie Henn and Jon Warnow <ref>{{cite book |last=McKibben |first=Bill |date=2013 |title=Oil and Honey |url= |location= |publisher=Times Books |page=12 |isbn=978-0-8050-9284-4 |author-link= }}</ref> |main_organ = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = {{url|www.350.org}} }}
'''350.org''' is an international [[environmental organization]] addressing [[climate change]] with the goal of reducing atmospheric [[carbon dioxide]] to 350[[Parts per million|ppm]] from the current level of 400 ppm.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://scripps.ucsd.edu/programs/keelingcurve/ |title=The Keeling Curve |publisher=Scripps Institution of Oceanography, UC San Diego |date=29 April 2015 |accessdate=29 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Thompson ([[Climate Central]]) |first=Andrea |date=May 19, 2016 |title=Atmospheric CO2 May Have Topped 400 PPM Permanently |url=https://insideclimatenews.org/news/18052016/atmospheric-co2-carbon-dioxide-400-ppm-climate-change-keeling-curve |newspaper=[[InsideClimate News]] |location= |access-date=August 12, 2016}}</ref> It was founded by author [[Bill McKibben]] with the goal of building a global [[grassroots]] movement to raise awareness about [[human impact on the environment|human-driven]] climate change, to confront [[climate change denial]], and to cut emissions of [[carbon dioxide]]<ref>{{cite web|last=Plass |first=Gilbert N. |url=http://www.scientificamerican.com/article.cfm?id=carbon-dioxide-and-climate |title=''Carbon Dioxide and Climate'' |publisher=[[Scientific American]] |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.350.org/story |title=Our Team's History|publisher=www.350.org |accessdate=October 18, 2009 }}</ref> in order to slow the rate of [[global warming]]. 350.org takes its name from the research of [[Goddard Institute for Space Studies]] scientist [[James E. Hansen]], who posited in a 2007 paper that 350 [[Parts per million|ppm]] of [[Carbon dioxide in Earth's atmosphere|CO<sub>2</sub> in the atmosphere]] is a safe upper limit to avoid a climate [[Tipping point (climatology)|tipping point]].<ref>“[http://unfccc.int/files/press/backgrounders/application/pdf/press_factsh_mitigation.pdf Fact sheet: The need for mitigation.]" ''[[United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change]]''. June 2009. ''(Retrieved 2009-09-01.)''</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/12/27/AR2007122701942.html | accessdate = September 1, 2009 | work=[[The Washington Post]] | first=Bill | last=McKibben | title=Remember This: 350 Parts Per Million | date=December 28, 2007}}</ref>
==Origins== [[Image:Bill McKibben at RIT-3.jpg|thumb|The founder of 350.org, Bill McKibben, speaking at the [[Rochester Institute of Technology]] in 2008.]]
350.org was founded by author Bill McKibben<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nymag.com/daily/movies/2009/09/no_impact_man_and_the_idiotocr.html |title=No Impact Man and the Idiotocracy – The Projectionist |publisher=[[New York (magazine)|New York]] |accessdate=September 17, 2009 }}</ref> and a group of students from Middlebury College. McKibben is an American environmentalist and writer who wrote one of the first books on global warming for the general public, and frequently writes about climate change, [[alternative energy]], and the need for more [[Local economies|localized economies]].
<!-- This [[Template:Anchor|Anchor]] is being used, please don't remove -->{{anchor|350safe}}The organizing effort drew its name from [[NASA]] climate scientist James Hansen's contention that any atmospheric concentration of CO<sub>2</sub> above 350 parts per million was unsafe. James Hansen opined that "if humanity wishes to preserve a planet similar to that on which civilization developed and to which life on [[Earth]] is [[adapted]], paleoclimate evidence and ongoing climate change suggest that CO<sub>2</sub> will need to be reduced from its current 385 ppm to at most 350 ppm, but likely less than that."<ref>[[James Hansen|Hansen, J.]], et al. "[http://pubs.giss.nasa.gov/abstracts/2008/Hansen_etal.html Target atmospheric CO2: Where should humanity aim?]" ''Open Atmospheric Science Journal'', 2, 217–231, 2008. ''(Retrieved i2009-09-01.)''</ref> Carbon dioxide, the main [[greenhouse gas]], rose by 2.6 parts per million to 396 ppm in 2013 from the previous year (annual global averages).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/|title=ESRL Global Monitoring Division - Global Greenhouse Gas Reference Network|first=US Department of Commerce, NOAA, Earth System Research|last=Laboratory|website=www.esrl.noaa.gov}}</ref> It already crossed 400 ppm in May 2012 on monitors in the industrialized [[Northern Hemisphere]]'s [[Arctic]] region.<ref>[https://www.usatoday.com/weather/climate/globalwarming/story/2012-05-31/carbon-dioxide-greehouse-gas-level-climate-change-global-warming/55312242/1 Scientists: Carbon dioxode at highest level in 800,000 years] May 31, 2012 (Seth Borenstein, Associated Press)</ref>
McKibben first started to organize against climate change with a walk across [[Vermont]], his home state. His "[[Step It Up 2007|Step It Up]]" campaign in 2007 involved 1,400 demonstrations at famous sites across the United States. McKibben credits these activities with making [[Hillary Clinton]] and [[Barack Obama]] change their [[Energy policy of the United States|energy policies]] during the presidential campaign. Starting in 2008, 350.org built upon the "Step It Up" campaign and made it into a global organization.
[[Rajendra Pachauri]], the UN's "top climate scientist" and leader of the [[Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change]] (IPCC) has come out, [[Climate change mitigation scenarios#350 ppm|as have others]], in favor of reducing atmospheric concentrations of carbon dioxide to 350 ppm.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2009/aug/26/pachauri-350ppm-breakthrough-climate |title=Pachauri's call for 350ppm is breakthrough moment for climate movement |publisher=guardian.co.uk |accessdate=September 15, 2009 | location=London | date=August 26, 2009 |first=Bill |last=McKibben}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/environmentalcapital/2009/08/25/climate-debate-ipcc-head-pachauri-joins-the-350-club/ |title=Climate Debate: IPCC Head Pachauri Joins the 350 Club |publisher=blogs.[[wsj.com]] |accessdate=September 15, 2009 |first=Keith |last=Johnson |date=August 25, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091029113927/https://blogs.wsj.com/environmentalcapital/2009/08/25/climate-debate-ipcc-head-pachauri-joins-the-350-club/ |archivedate=October 29, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hacayDuUcngLmhNkplHB5VtG5GNw |title=AFP: Top UN climate scientist backs ambitious CO2 cuts |publisher=www.google.com | work=[[Agence France-Presse]] |accessdate=September 15, 2009 }}</ref> McKibben called news of Pachauri's embrace of the 350ppm target "amazing".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blogs.nature.com/news/thegreatbeyond/2009/08/pachauri_endorses_350ppm_co2_t.html |title=The Great Beyond: Pachauri endorses 350ppm CO2 target |publisher=[[Nature (journal)|Nature]] |accessdate=September 17, 2009 }}</ref> Some media have indicated that Pachauri's endorsement of the 350 ppm target was a victory for 350.org's activism.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailygreen.com/environmental-news/latest/350-global-warming-47082505 |title=UN Scientist Rajendra Pachauri - Colbert Bump for 350.org - thedailygreen.com |publisher=thedailygreen.com |accessdate=September 17, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091005180325/http://www.thedailygreen.com/environmental-news/latest/350-global-warming-47082505 |archivedate=October 5, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.triplepundit.com/2009/08/un-scientist-claims-350-ppm-is-new-magic-number/ |title=UN Scientist Claims 350 PPM Is New Magic Number | Triple Pundit |publisher=www.triplepundit.com |accessdate=September 17, 2009 }}</ref>
The organization had a lift in prominence after McKibben appeared on [[The Colbert Report]] television show on Monday August 17, 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comedycentral.com/colbertreport/full-episodes/index.jhtml?episodeId=240770 |title=The Colbert Report Full Episode | Monday Aug 17 2009 | Comedy Central |publisher=[[Comedy Central]] |accessdate=September 18, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091003095928/http://www.comedycentral.com/colbertreport/full-episodes/index.jhtml?episodeId=240770 |archivedate=October 3, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.greenrightnow.com/kabc/2009/08/26/350org-enjoys-the-colbert-bump/ |publisher = ABC7.com Green Content |title=350.org enjoys the 'Colbert bump' |work=www.greenrightnow.com |accessdate=September 17, 2009|archiveurl =https://archive.is/20120630113535/http://www.greenrightnow.com/kabc/2009/08/26/350org-enjoys-the-colbert-bump/|archivedate =30 June 2012 |last = Kessler |first =Barbara}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.colbertnation.com/the-colbert-report-videos/246941/august-17-2009/bill-mckibben |title=Bill McKibben | The Colbert Report 05112 | ColbertNation.com |publisher=[[Colbert Nation]] |accessdate=September 17, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090918203156/http://www.colbertnation.com/the-colbert-report-videos/246941/august-17-2009/bill-mckibben |archivedate=September 18, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref> McKibben promotes the organization on speaking tours and by writing articles about it for many major newspapers and media, such as the [[Los Angeles Times]]<ref>{{cite news |url=http://articles.latimes.com/2009/may/15/opinion/oe-mckibben15 |title=Can 350.org save the world? – Los Angeles Times |publisher=[[Latimes.com]] |accessdate=September 18, 2009 | first=Bill | last=McKibben | date=May 15, 2009}}</ref> and [[The Guardian]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2009/sep/26/350-carbon-atmosphere-copenhagen-mckibben |title=Why 350 is the most important number on the planet |publisher=[[Guardian.co.uk]] |accessdate=September 26, 2009 |location=London |date=September 26, 2009 |first=Bill |last=McKibben |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091003123956/http://www.guardian.co.uk/environment/2009/sep/26/350-carbon-atmosphere-copenhagen-mckibben |archivedate=October 3, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref>
In 2012 the organization was presented with the 2012 [[Katerva]] Award for [[Behavioural change theories|Behavioural Change]].<ref>{{cite web|title=2012 Finalists|url=http://katerva.org|accessdate=October 8, 2012}}</ref>
==Goals== The 350.org movement considers the atmospheric concentration 350ppm of CO<sub>2</sub> as a safe upper limit. This limit was the focus a 2009 [[COP15]] international treaty.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.cop15.dk/ |title=Home – COP15 United Nations Climate Change Conference Copenhagen 2009 |publisher=[[2009 United Nations Climate Change Conference]] |accessdate=September 15, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090918051433/http://en.cop15.dk/ |archivedate=September 18, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref> 350.org's goal is to have governments adopt policies to lower carbon dioxide emissions. In spite of this goal, "[i]n 2013, CO2 levels surpassed 400 ppm for the first time in recorded history."<ref>{{Cite web|title = Graphic: The relentless rise of carbon dioxide |url=https://climate.nasa.gov/climate_resources/24/ |website=NASA.gov |accessdate = 2015-08-12}}</ref> 350.org reports: "This March [2015], global levels of CO2 passed 400 parts per million."<ref>{{Cite web|title = 400 ppm CO2: What It Means|url = http://400.350.org/|website = 400 ppm CO2: What It Means|accessdate = 2015-08-12}}</ref>
350.org aims to build a global, grassroots movement to take on the [[fossil fuel]] industry and solve the climate crisis. Through online campaigns, grassroots organizing, and mass public actions, 350.org has mobilized thousands of volunteer organizers in over 188 countries. {{citation needed|date=April 2014}}
Climate safety and climate justice for people across the globe is a critical part of 350.org's mission. By working with local community groups, 350.org aims to hold corporations and world leaders accountable to the realities of science and the principles of social justice.
==Science of 350== 350 parts per million is what scientists{{who|date=August 2018}}, climate experts{{who|date=August 2018}}, and progressive national governments{{who|date=August 2018}} are now saying is the safe upper limit for CO<sub>2</sub> in our atmosphere. In May 2013, two independent teams of scientists measuring CO<sub>2</sub> near the summit of [[Mauna Loa]] in Hawaii recorded that the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere exceeded 400 parts per million, probably for the first time in more than 3 million years of Earth history.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/energy/2013/05/130510-earth-co2-milestone-400-ppm/|title=Climate Milestone: Earth’s CO2 Level Passes 400 ppm|date=May 12, 2013|publisher=}}</ref> The amount of CO<sub>2</sub> in the atmosphere is continuing to rise at about 2 ppm every year.
{{convert|2|C-change|F-change|1}} was agreed upon during the 2009 [[Copenhagen Accord]] as a limit for global temperature rise. The accord formally recognized "the scientific view that the increase in global temperature should be below two degrees Celsius."<ref>http://unfccc.int/resource/docs/2009/cop15/eng/11a01.pdf</ref> The next paragraph declared that "we agree that deep cuts in global emissions are required... so as to hold the increase in global temperature below two degrees Celsius." In order to stay below a 2 degree increase, scientists have estimated that humans can pour roughly 565 more gigatons of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. At present emission rates, (31 gigatons globally in 2011 and rising) 565 gigatons will be reached by 2028.<ref name="rollingstone.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/news/global-warmings-terrifying-new-math-20120719|title=Global Warming's Terrifying New Math|publisher=}}</ref>
Fossil-fuel companies currently have about 2,795 gigatons of carbon already contained in their proven coal and oil and gas reserves, and is the amount of fossil fuels they are currently planning to burn. 2,795 gigatons is five times higher than the limit of 565 gigatons that would keep Earth under a global temperature increase of 2 degrees Celsius.<ref name="rollingstone.com"/>
==Campaigns and projects==
===Keystone XL pipeline=== 350.org has named the [[Keystone XL pipeline]] as a critical issue and turning point for the environmental movement, as well as for President Obama's legacy. NASA climatologist James Hansen labeled the Keystone XL pipeline as "game over" for the planet, and called the amount of carbon stored in Canadian bitumen sands a "fuse to the largest carbon bomb on the planet."<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/08/29/idUS257590805720110829 | work=Reuters | title=NASA's Hansen Explains Decision to Join Keystone Pipeline Protests | date=August 29, 2011}}</ref>
350.org cites oil spills along the proposed pipeline route, which would pass near Texas' Carrizo-Wilcox Aquifer, which supplies drinking water to more than 12 million people. It could also pose danger to the Ogallala Aquifer, the largest aquifer in western North America that supplies drinking water and irrigation to millions of people and agricultural businesses.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://insideclimatenews.org/news/20120426/keystone-xl-nebraska-sandhills-ogallala+aquifer-heineman-transcanada|title=News|publisher=}}</ref> 350.org has opposed the economic argument that has been made by proponents of the pipeline, arguing that Keystone XL would create only a few thousand temporary jobs during construction. The State Department estimated that ultimately the pipeline will create 35 permanent jobs.<ref>http://keystonepipeline-xl.state.gov/documents/organization/205612.pdf</ref>
Contrary to oil industry claims, the National Resources Defense Council (NRDC) has said that the Keystone XL pipeline will increase gas prices instead of lowering them. The NRDC's study also refutes the claim that the pipeline will lead to energy independence, because the pipeline will carry tar sands from Canada to Texas which will then be sold on the global market.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.nrdc.org/energy/keystone-pipeline/files/Keystone-Oil-Prices-Report.pdf |title=Link }}</ref>
Partly due to efforts from 350.org and other organizations, President Obama officially rejected the building of Keystone XL on November 6, 2015.<ref name="Davenport">{{Cite news|title = Citing Climate Change, Obama Rejects Construction of Keystone XL Oil Pipeline|url = https://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/07/us/obama-expected-to-reject-construction-of-keystone-xl-oil-pipeline.html|newspaper = The New York Times|date = 2015-11-06|access-date = 2015-11-07|issn = 0362-4331|first = Coral|last = Davenport}}</ref> This marked the end of a seven-year review on the pipeline. Speaking on the decision, Bill McKibben said, “President Obama is the first world leader to reject a project because of its effect on the climate. That gives him new stature as an environmental leader, and it eloquently confirms the five years and millions of hours of work that people of every kind put into this fight.”<ref name="Davenport"/>
===Fossil fuel divestment=== {{Main|Fossil fuel divestment}} {{See also|Fossil fuel phase-out}}
350.org launched their "Go Fossil Free: Divest from Fossil Fuels!" campaign in 2012 with Bill McKibben's "Do The Math" speaking tour around the country. The campaign calls for colleges and universities, as well as cities, religious institutions, and pension funds to withdraw their investments from fossil fuel companies. 350.org explains that the reasoning behind this campaign is simple: "If it is wrong to wreck the climate, then it is wrong to profit from that wreckage."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gofossilfree.org/about/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-08-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131114164835/http://gofossilfree.org/about/ |archivedate=November 14, 2013 |df=mdy }}</ref> 350.org states their demand as the following "We want institutions to immediately freeze any new investment in fossil fuel companies, and divest from direct ownership and any commingled funds that include fossil fuel public equities and corporate bonds within 5 years."
There are currently fossil fuel divestment campaigns at 308 colleges and universities, 105 cities and states, and 6 religious institutions. As of July 2013, six colleges and universities (San Francisco State University, Hampshire, College, Unity College, Sterling College, College of the Atlantic, and Green Mountain College) have committed to fossil fuel divestment. Seventeen cities (Seattle, WA; San Francisco, CA; Portland, OR; Eugene, OR; Berkeley, CA; Richmond, CA; Santa Monica, CA; Boulder, CO; Santa Fe, NM; Madison, WI; Bayfield, WI; State College, PA; Ithaca, NY; Truro, MA; Provincetown, MA; Providence, RI; and Cambridge, MA) have made commitments to divest. Twelve religious institutions (United Church of Christ – National, Massachusetts United Church of Christ, Minnesota United Church of Christ, Evangelical Lutheran Church of Oregon, First Unitarian Church of Salt Lake City, First Parish Unitarian Universalist Church in Cambridge, MA, Portsmouth South Church Unitarian, First Unitarian Church of Pittsfield, ME, First Unitarian Society of Milwaukee, Uniting Church, New South Wales & ACT, Australia, Dover Friends Meeting, Dover, NH, Melbourne Unitarian Church, Australia) have also committed to fossil fuel divestment.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gofossilfree.org/commitments/|title=Commitments|publisher=}}</ref>
===''Do The Math'' movie=== The ''Do The Math'' movie is a 42-minute documentary film about the rising movement to change the terrifying math of the climate crisis and challenge the fossil fuel industry. The math revolves around these three numbers: to stay below 2 degrees Celsius of global warming we can emit only 565 more gigatons of carbon dioxide versus the 2,795 gigatons held in proven reserves by fossil fuel corporations. This warming rise was agreed to in the 2009 [[Copenhagen Summit]] as a limit. NASA scientist [[James Hansen]] says "2 degrees of warming is actually a prescription for long-term disaster."<ref>Bill McKibben (2013). "Oil and Honey". Henry Holt and Company. p. 143</ref>
===Global Power Shift === Phase 1 of Global Power Shift was a convergence in [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] in June 2013 of about five-hundred climate organizers from 135 countries. Stated objectives include sharing and developing skills to organize movements, building upon existing plans to organize in-country Power Shift events after the kickoff event in Turkey, building political alignment and a clear [[theory of change]], sharing experiences from different countries, formulating strategies to overcome challenges, and building relationships to strengthen regional and international cooperation and collaboration.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globalpowershift.org/|title=Global Power Shift|website=globalpowershift.org}}</ref>
Phase 2 of Global Power Shift involves the organizers who were in Turkey in June 2013 to bring home what they learned to organize summits, events, and mobilizations.
===Summer Heat=== 350.org launched the Summer Heat campaign in the Summer of 2013, and was a wave of mass mobilizations across the country. Summer Heat actions took place at eleven locations: Richmond, CA; Vancouver, WA; Green River, UT; Albuquerque, NM; Houston, TX; [[St. Ignace, Michigan|St. Ignace, MI]]; Warren, OH; Washington, D.C.; Camp David, MD; Somerset, MA; and Sebago Lake, ME. Participants included grassroots organizers, labor unions, farmers, ranchers, environmental justice groups, and others. The slogan that was used for the Summer Heat campaign was: ''As The Temperature Rises, So Do We.''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://joinsummerheat.org/|title=Summer Heat|website=joinsummerheat.org}}</ref>
==Activities==
===International Day of Climate Action=== [[File:Climate change protests, Melbourne.jpg|thumb|300px|Thousands of Cyclists in [[Melbourne]] for the 350 Climate Protest, October 24, 2009]] [[Image:Taganrog Russia 350.org.jpg|thumb|300px|International Day of Climate Action. Taganrog, Rostov Region, Russia. October 24, 2009]] An "International Day of Climate Action" on October 24, 2009, was organized by 350.org to influence the delegates going to the [[United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change]] meeting in December, [[United Nations Climate Change Conference 2009|2009]] ([[COP15]]).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.japantoday.com/category/features/view/350-the-magic-number |title=350: The magic number |publisher=[[Japan Today]] |accessdate=September 15, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://thevarsity.ca/2009/10/26/countdown-to-copenhagen/ |title=Countdown to Copenhagen |publisher=[[The Varsity (newspaper)|The Varsity]] |accessdate=September 15, 2009|last =Gould|first =Alixandra }}</ref> This was the first global campaign ever organized around a scientific [[data point]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aspentimes.com/article/20091019/NEWS/910199997/1077&ParentProfile=1058 |title=Aspen to spell it out: 'Save Snow' | AspenTimes.com |publisher=[[Aspen Times]]aspentimes.com |accessdate=October 20, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091022073541/http://www.aspentimes.com/article/20091019/NEWS/910199997/1077%26ParentProfile%3D1058 |archivedate=October 22, 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }}</ref> The actions organised by 350.org included gigantic depictions of the number "350",<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bloomingtonalternative.com/node/10203 |title=Bloomington and the world campaign against climate change | The Bloomington Alternative |publisher=www.bloomingtonalternative.com |accessdate=October 19, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100206060057/http://bloomingtonalternative.com/node/10203 |archive-date=February 6, 2010 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1251804522055&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull |title=350-degree turnaround needed in climate change talks | Science and Environment | Jerusalem Post |publisher=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |accessdate=September 15, 2009 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> walks,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.theworldlink.com/articles/2009/09/21/news/doc4ab7b52f17668750534104.txt |title=The World Link : Activist's 350-mile trek highlights climate change |publisher=www.theworldlink.com |accessdate=September 22, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.oregonlive.com/opinion/index.ssf/2009/09/why_i_am_walking_350_miles.html |title=Why I am walking 350 miles |publisher=[[OregonLive.com]] |accessdate=September 17, 2009 |date=September 9, 2009}}</ref> marches, rallies, [[teach-in]]s, bike rides, sing-a-thons, carbon-free dinners, retrofitting houses to save energy,<ref name="eco" /> tree plantings,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.scientificamerican.com/podcast/episode.cfm?id=can-trees-save-us-from-climate-chan-09-04-24 |title=Can Trees Save Us from Climate Change? Trees and other plants suck up carbon dioxide, so we might think planting forests will halt global warming. Unfortunately, it's not that simple |publisher=Scientific American |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref> mass dives at the [[Great Barrier Reef]], [[solar cooker|solar-cooked]] bake-outs, churches bell ringings, underwater cabinet meetings ([[Maldives]]),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.treehugger.com/files/2009/10/maldives-underwater-cabinet-meeting.php |title=Maldives Holds Underwater Cabinet Meeting To Bring Attention to Climate Change : TreeHugger |publisher=[[TreeHugger]] |accessdate=October 20, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091021054313/http://www.treehugger.com/files/2009/10/maldives-underwater-cabinet-meeting.php |archivedate=October 21, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/article34170.ece |title=Maldives cabinet to meet underwater to highlight perils of climate change |publisher=[[The Hindu]] |accessdate=October 17, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091016112724/http://beta.thehindu.com/news/international/article34170.ece |archivedate=October 16, 2009 |deadurl=no |location=Chennai, India |first=B. Muralidhar |last=Reddy |date=October 15, 2009 |df=mdy }}</ref> and armband distributions to athletes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS121270+17-Apr-2009+BW20090417 |title=MetLife Returns for a Second Year As Professional Cycling Teams Title Sponsor|publisher=Reuters |accessdate=September 18, 2009 | date=April 17, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20670001&sid=ah3oaNsR56Ms |title=Bloomberg Printer-Friendly Page |publisher=[[bloomberg.com]] |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metlife.com/about/press-room/us-press-releases/index.html?compID=12765 |title=2009 Press Releases at MetLife |publisher=[[MetLife]] |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }}</ref> The organization reported that over 5,200 synchronized demonstrations occurred in 181 countries on the day.<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/25/science/earth/25threefifty.html | work=[[The New York Times]] | first=Andrew C. | last=Revkin | authorlink= Andrew Revkin |title=Campaign Against Emissions Picks Number | date=October 25, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/10/24/international.climate.change.demonstrations | work=[[CNN.com]] | title=International day of demonstrations on climate change | date=October 26, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://cbs5.com/local/350.climate.change.2.1269623.html |title=Group Holds '350' Climate Change Rally in SF - cbs5.com |publisher=[[KPIX-TV]] |accessdate=October 26, 2009 }}</ref> The group reports that they organised the world's "most widespread day of political action" on Saturday October 24, 2009, reporting 5,245 actions in 181 countries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.350.org/ |title=350.org |publisher=www.350.org |accessdate=October 28, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091029155956/http://www.350.org/ |archivedate=October 29, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.good.is/post/the-global-climate-movement-comes-of-age/ |title=The Global Climate Movement Comes of Age |publisher=[[good.is|GOOD]] |accessdate=October 28, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091031044221/http://www.good.is/post/the-global-climate-movement-comes-of-age/ |archivedate=October 31, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://dn.sapo.pt/inicio/portugal/interior.aspx?content_id=1400500&seccao=Sul |title=Dezenas de pessoas apelam a acordo na Cimeira de Copenhaga |publisher=[[Diário de Notícias]] |date=December 6, 2009 |accessdate=November 6, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091026001144/http://dn.sapo.pt/inicio/portugal/interior.aspx?content_id=1400500&seccao=Sul |archivedate=October 26, 2009 }}</ref>
===10/10/10 Global Work Party=== [[Image:Greenbakinsi-2.JPG|thumb|border|300px|10.10.10.<br />350.org in [[Baku]], [[Azerbaijan]]]] As a follow-up to 2009's International Day of Climate Action, 350.org and the [[10:10|10:10 Climate Campaign]] joined to help coordinate another global day of action which occurred on October 10, 2010. The 2010 campaign was focused on concrete actions that can be taken locally to help combat climate change. Actions from tree-plantings to solar panel installations to huge electricity service-provider switching parties occurred in almost every country around the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lohud.com/article/20101011/NEWS02/10110329/-1/newsfront/Community-Gardeners-in-Ossining-have-own-Global-Work-Party |title=Community Gardeners in Ossining have own Global Work Party | LoHud.com | The Journal News |publisher=LoHud.com |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wlbt.com/Global/story.asp?S=13300079 |title=Global work party focuses on global warming prevention |publisher=[[WLBT]] 3 – Jackson, MS| date=November 2, 2012 |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/science/ci_16305629?nclick_check=1 |title=Silicon Valley joins Global Work Party to combat climate change |publisher=[[San Jose Mercury News]] |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref>
===Connect the Dots 5 May 2012=== The organization's efforts continued into 2012 with a planned May 5 worldwide series of rallies under the slogan "Connect the Dots," to draw attention to the links between [[climate change]] and [[extreme weather]].<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/18/science/earth/americans-link-global-warming-to-extreme-weather-poll-says.html | work=The New York Times | first=Justin | last=Gillis | title=Americans Link Global Warming to Extreme Weather, Poll Says | date=April 17, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theecologist.org/how_to_make_a_difference/climate_change_and_energy/1330459/take_action_to_connect_the_dots_on_climate_change.html |title=TAKE ACTION to connect the dots on climate change – Make a difference |publisher=The Ecologist |date=April 27, 2012 |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref> Per the 350.org website the day is called '''Climate Impacts Day'''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.climatedots.org/ |title=Connect the Dots |publisher=Climatedots.org |date=May 5, 2012 |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.350.org/en/about/blogs/climate-impacts-day-visit-vanishing-glacier |title=On Climate Impacts Day, a visit to a vanishing glacier |publisher=350.org |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref>
===People's Climate March=== 350 helped organize the [[People's Climate March]], which took place on September 21, 2014.<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2014/09/18/nyregion/busy-days-precede-climate-change-march-in-manhattan-on-sunday.html SEPT. 17, 2014</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/news/a-call-to-arms-an-invitation-to-demand-action-on-climate-change-20140521|title=A Call to Arms: An Invitation to Demand Action on Climate Change|publisher=}}</ref>
===General activities=== Apart from special events, 350.org organizes actions on an ongoing basis to promote its message. These activities include tree plantings (350 trees in each instance) for [[biosequestration]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.greenleft.org.au/2009/809/41623 |title=Green Left – Oil, gas and coal: climate vandalism in WA |publisher=www.greenleft.org.au |accessdate=September 17, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090911032511/http://www.greenleft.org.au/2009/809/41623 |archivedate=September 11, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.coffscoastadvocate.com.au/story/2009/09/18/challenge-from-bdc-to-make-target-350/ |title=Challenge from BDC to make target '350' | Local News | Coffs Coast Advocate |publisher=[[The Coffs Coast Advocate]] |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manchesterjournal.com/ci_13352932 |title=Local Fruit Tree Planting Project is Blossoming |publisher=www.manchesterjournal.com |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newschannel34.com/content/developingnews/story/Sustainability-Coalition-Hosts-Planning-Meeting/9FiBKuzyFE24P_UuRIEUUg.cspx |title=Sustainability Coalition Hosts Planning Meeting for Climate Change Campaign – WIVT/WBGH Newschannel34 |publisher=[[WIVT]] |accessdate=September 19, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090924112003/http://www.newschannel34.com/content/developingnews/story/Sustainability-Coalition-Hosts-Planning-Meeting/9FiBKuzyFE24P_UuRIEUUg.cspx |archivedate=September 24, 2009 |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.guampdn.com/article/20091007/NEWS01/910070320/1002 |title=Guam joins Global Day of Climate Action |publisher= [[Pacific Daily News]] |accessdate=October 7, 2009 }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.news-press.com/article/20091017/LIFESTYLES/910170333/1013/LIFESTYLES |title=Fort Myers native plant sale offers positive ways to reduce carbon dioxide levels | news-press.com | The News-Press |publisher=[[The News-Press]] |accessdate=October 18, 2009 }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> promoting the term "350",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timestranscript.canadaeast.com/news/article/793279 |title=Sackville goes green |publisher=timestranscript.canadaeast.com |accessdate=September 17, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724185320/http://timestranscript.canadaeast.com/news/article/793279 |archivedate=July 24, 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/nelson-mail/features/home-and-garden/going-green/2855601/Stand-up-to-make-a-statement |title=Stand up to make a statement | Stuff.co.nz |publisher=[[Fairfax New Zealand]] news portal |accessdate=September 17, 2009 }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://finance.sfgate.com/iphone?GUID=5672662&Page=MediaViewer&ChannelID=3197 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120630113628/http://finance.sfgate.com/iphone?GUID=5672662&Page=MediaViewer&ChannelID=3197 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=June 30, 2012 |title=FinancialContent.com – Stock Quotes and Business News |publisher=San Francisco Chronicle |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }} </ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.swvatoday.com/comments/350_gives_us_a_target/news/6012/ |title='350 gives us a target' - SWVAToday.com |publisher=SW Virginia Today |accessdate=September 18, 2009 |publisher=[[TreeHugger]].com |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }}</ref> publishing adverts in major newspapers calling for the target level of carbon dioxide to be lowered to 350ppm,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2008/jun/23/fossilfuels.climatechange?gusrc=rss&feed=environment |title=Put oil firm chiefs on trial, says leading climate change scientist |publisher=guardian.co.uk |accessdate=September 18, 2009 | location=London | first=Ed | last=Pilkington | date=June 23, 2008}}</ref> conducting polls on the subject of climate change,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/286069,survey-asians-see-obama-as-man-to-lead-fight-on.html |title=Survey: Asians see Obama as man to lead fight on climate change : Environment |publisher=Earth Times |accessdate=September 17, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.cop15.dk/news/view+news?newsid=2119 |title=People of Asia want their governments to act – COP15 United Nations Climate Change Conference Copenhagen 2009 |publisher=en.cop15.dk |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }}</ref> educating youth leaders,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://itsgettinghotinhere.org/2009/09/08/caribbean-youth-call-for-350ppm-urgent-action-in-copenhagen/ |title=Caribbean Youth Call for 350ppm, Urgent Action in Copenhagen " It's Getting Hot in Here |publisher=itsgettinghotinhere.org |accessdate=September 17, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090910075218/http://itsgettinghotinhere.org/2009/09/08/caribbean-youth-call-for-350ppm-urgent-action-in-copenhagen/ |archive-date=September 10, 2009 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://joongangdaily.joins.com/article/view.asp?aid=2909174 |title=Kids urge leaders to do more to protect Earth – INSIDE JoongAng Daily |publisher=[[JoongAng Ilbo]] |accessdate=September 17, 2009 }}</ref> lobbying governments on the issue of carbon targets,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-national/greenies-urge-australia-to-lead-world-20091016-h0sc.html |title=Greenies urge Australia to lead world |publisher=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |accessdate=October 16, 2009 | date=October 16, 2009}}</ref> and joining a campaign to establish a [[.eco]] [[top-level domain]] or "tld".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.streetinsider.com/Press+Releases/Dot+Eco+LLC+and+350.org+Announce+Mutual+Support+of+Their+Missions+to+Rise+to+the+Challenge+of+the+Climate+Crisis/4892286.html |title=StreetInsider.com – Dot Eco LLC and 350.org Announce Mutual Support of Their Missions to Rise to the Challenge of the Climate Crisis |publisher=www.streetinsider.com |accessdate=September 18, 2009 }}</ref> In December 2009, the group petitioned the [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] to set national limits for greenhouse gases using the [[Clean Air Act (United States)|Clean Air Act]], asking the agency to cap atmospheric concentrations of carbon dioxide at 350 parts per million.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/gwire/2009/12/02/02greenwire-groups-petition-epa-to-set-greenhouse-gas-limi-40485.html |title=Groups Petition EPA to Set Greenhouse Gas Limits Under Clean Air Act 27 |publisher=[[NYTimes.com]] |accessdate=December 3, 2009 |date=December 2, 2009 |first=Robin |last=Bravender |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091203054156/http://www.nytimes.com/gwire/2009/12/02/02greenwire-groups-petition-epa-to-set-greenhouse-gas-limi-40485.html |archivedate=December 3, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref> The organization created and distributed a [[time-lapse]] video showing the recent retreat of [[Mendenhall Glacier]] in [[Alaska]], graphically depicting the impacts of warming climates.<ref name="GlacierVideo">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6dFbuaz130c|title=350 Days in the life of a retreating glacier|first=|last=350.org|date=August 21, 2009|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref> On President's Day, February 18, 2013, it is co-organizing a national day of action to call on President Obama to address climate change.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Gerhardt|first=Tina|date=January 9, 2013|title=70 Groups Send Letter to President Obama Urging Action on Climate Change|url=http://www.progressive.org/green-groups-urge-obama-to-act-on-climate-change|work=[[The Progressive]]}}</ref>
==Membership== 350.org claims alliance with 300 organizations around the world<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.350.org/friends |title=Friends & Allies |publisher=350.org |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.350.org/people |title=People |publisher=350.org |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref> and has enlisted "350 messengers" who have publicly allied themselves with the organization or its goal to spread the 350 movement,<ref name="eco">{{cite web |url=http://www.theecologist.org/take_action/campaigns/283705/can_you_party_like_its_350.html |title=Take Action – Campaigns – 350.org – the ultimate climate change campaign? |publisher=[[The Ecologist]] |accessdate=September 16, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zmag.org/znet/viewArticlePrint/22377 |title=Emergency Appeal – Please, We Urgently Need Your Help Now! |publisher=[[Z Communications]] |accessdate=October 26, 2009 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> including Archbishop [[Desmond Tutu]], [[Alex Steffen]],<ref>{{cite web|author=Planetary Thinking |url=http://www.alexsteffen.com/worldchanging-2-0/ |title=Worldchanging 2.0 Alex Steffen |publisher=Alexsteffen.com |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121113224618/http://www.alexsteffen.com/worldchanging-2-0/ |archivedate=November 13, 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.350.org/en/messengers |title=350 Messengers |publisher=350.org |date=December 10, 2007 |accessdate=November 6, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121024072552/http://www.350.org/en/messengers |archivedate=October 24, 2012 }}</ref> [[Bianca Jagger]], [[David Suzuki]], and [[Colin Beavan]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/10/24/international.climate.change.demonstrations/ |title=International day of demonstrations on climate change |publisher=[[CNN.com]] |accessdate=October 26, 2009 |date=October 26, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091027062303/http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/10/24/international.climate.change.demonstrations/ |archivedate=October 27, 2009 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref>
[[1Sky]] merged into 350.org in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huntingtonnews.net/3576 |title=Rockefellers' 1Sky Unveils the New 350.org: More $ – More Delusion |publisher=Huntington News |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Klein |first=Naomi|authorlink=Naomi Klein|url=http://www.1sky.org/blog/2011/04/joining-350org-the-next-phase |title=Joining 350.org: The Next Phase |publisher=[[1Sky]] |date=August 30, 2010 |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.350.org/en/new350-announcement |title=A BIG Announcement. |publisher=350.org |date= |accessdate=November 6, 2012}}</ref>
[[Naomi Klein]] (author of ''[[This Changes Everything: Capitalism vs. the Climate]]'') is a member of the board of directors of 350.org.

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Aubert de la Rue, Edgar | image = Kerguelen RallierDuBatty.JPG | caption = Raillier du Baty Peninsula (named by Edgar Aubert de le Rue) | birth_date = 7 October 1901 | birth_place = Geneva | death_date = {{Death-date and age|24 February 1991|07 October 1901}} | death_place = Lausanne | nationality = Swiss | occupation = Geographer and Geologist | known_for = Exploration | spouse = Andrée }}
'''Edgar Aubert de la Rüe''' (1901–1991) was a [[France|French]] [[geographer]], [[geologist]], traveller and photographer who was primarily devoted to the islands of [[Saint Pierre and Miquelon]], [[Kerguelen Islands|Kerguelen]], and [[Vanuatu]]. [[Mount Aubert de la Rue]] on [[Heard Island and McDonald Islands|Heard Island]] is named after him.
==Biography<ref>[http://www.academieoutremer.fr/academiciens/fiche.php?aId=572 Academy of Sciences of Outre Mer] {{Fr icon}}</ref>== Edgar Aubert de la Rüe was born on 7 October 1901 in [[Geneva]] (Switzerland) and died on 24 February 1991 in [[Lausanne]].
He took on the duties of an engineer-geologist from the [[Nancy-Université|University of Nancy]] and a scientific adviser for the [[French Southern and Antarctic Lands]]. He was also a Doctor of [[Natural Science]] from the [[University of Paris]].
He dedicated himself to the islands of [[Saint Pierre and Miquelon]] (1932, 1935, 1937, 1941 to 1943, 1948, and 1970), [[Kerguelen Islands|Kerguelen]] (1928, 1929, 1931, and from 1949 to 1953), and [[Vanuatu]], and from November 1937 to May 1938 he stayed in [[French Somaliland]].
As an Associate of the [[National Museum of Natural History (France)|National Museum of Natural History]] in Paris, his geological activities led him to difficult surveys all around the French Union: [[French protectorate in Morocco|Morocco]], [[Ivory Coast]], [[Republic of the Congo|Middle Congo]], [[French Madagascar|Madagascar]], [[Réunion]], [[French Mandate for Syria and the Lebanon|Syria - Lebanon]], and [[French Polynesia]].
Edgar Aubert de la Rüe was elected as a corresponding member of the ''Académie des sciences d’outre-mer'' on 7 December 1951.
He was Professor of higher studies of Latin America from 1965 to 1967.<ref>[http://catalogue.bnf.fr/servlet/autorite?ID=12117281&idNoeud=1.3&host=catalogue BnF catalogue] {{Fr icon}}</ref>
;Summary of his Travels *[[Kerguelen Islands|Kerguelen Archipelago]]: 12 November 1928 to 25 February 1929, 25 January to 27 March 1931, 11 December 1949 to 16 January 1950, 12 December 1951 to 6 January 1953; *[[Saint Pierre and Miquelon]]: 7 journeys (1932, 1935, 1937, 1939, 1941 to 1943, 1948, 1970) totalling three years; *[[French Somaliland]]: November 1937 to May 1938, accompanied by his wife. *Numerous other journeys - always with his wife - notably [[Patagonia]], [[Brazil]], and Vanuatu.
==Kerguelen Islands<ref name=Kerguelen>[http://www.kerguelen-voyages.com/c/95/p/d380801a66d0628dde0328650b93c643/iles-kerguelen-edgar-aubert-de-la-rue.html Kerguelen Voyages] {{Fr icon}}</ref>== Edgar Aubert de la rue made six journeys to the [[Kerguelen Islands]] ranging from six weeks to over a year. He spent in total more than two years in the islands - mostly with his wife Andrée. He made a significant contribution to the geology and biology of the area including two maps published in 1932 and 1952.
His first visit was from 12 November 1928 to 25 February 1929 when he stayed at Port-Couvreux and Port-Jeanne d’Arc and explored the coasts and the islands aboard whaling vessels. From 24 January to the end of March 1931, he was commissioned to undertake a geological expedition for the Ministry of Colonies. From these two journeys came, in 1932, a thesis which was a sum of his unique knowledge of the Kerguelens at that time. Edgar Aubert de la Rüe returned to the Kerguelens from 11 December 1949 to 16 January 1950 and again from 12 December 1951 to January 1953 as a geologist and scientific adviser. He assisted in the first years of creation of the current database.
The many place names that he assigned during his expedition scan be classified into different categories: - Descriptive names for the majority of his place names. - Names of professors and colleagues - e.g. Gandillot, Léon, Lu-taud, Jérémine... - Names of scientists or explorers on previous expeditions - e.g. Valdivia, Chun, Etienne Peau, Rallier du Baty... - Name of his wife: Andrée Aubert de la Rüe.
;List of place names assigned in the Kerguelen Islands by Edgar Aubert de la Rüe<ref name=Kerguelen/> {{div col|colwidth=15em}} *Acoena (Valley) *Agates (Mountains) *Albatros (River) *Américains (River) *Andrée Aubert de la Rüe (Mountains) *Azorella (Hill) *Banquise (Cove) *Bélier (Island) *Belle-Ile *Bellevue (Hills) *Bellouard (Island) *Ben Edra (Point) *Berland (Islet) *Blanc (Mountain) *Bleu (Lake) *Brisée (Rock) *Cabanes (Point) *Cachée (River) *Cagne (Islets) *Canards (Pond) *Carroz (Mountain) *Cataractes (River) *Central (Plateau) *Charbon (Ravine) *Charbon (Valley) *Charrier (Bay) *Château (Crater) *Château (River) *Chionis (Point) *Chun (Lake) *Citadelle (The) *Cormorans (Islet) *Coupole (The) *Créneaux (The) *Dauphins (Point) *Demi-Lune (Pass) *Diane (Rock) *Doris == Publications == * 1928: ''Precious and Ornamental stones'', Lechevalier, Paris, 301 p. {{Fr icon}} * 1930: ''Unknown French Lands (Islands of Kerguelen-Crozet-Saint-Paul-Nouvelle-Amsterdam)'', SPE, Paris, 189 p. {{Fr icon}} * 1932: ''Geological and geographical study of the Kerguelen archipelago'', Revue de géographie physique et de géographie dynamique, Paris, 231 p. + XXV pl. + 2 maps {{Fr icon}} * 1935: ''Man and the Islands'', Gallimard, coll. géographie humaine Paris, 194 p. No. 6 {{Fr icon}} * 1937: ''The Territory of Saint-Pierre et Miquelon: Study of physical and human geography'' [http://www.persee.fr/web/revues/home/prescript/article/jsa_0037-9174_1937_num_29_2_1957 Read online] {{Fr icon}} * 1937: ''The Territory of Saint-Pierre et Miquelon'', Journal de la Société des américanistes, Paris, 133 p., 6 pl. 1 map {{Fr icon}} * 1939: ''French Somaliland'', Gallimard, Coll. Géographie humaine, Paris n° 16 {{Fr icon}} * 1947: ''The region of Mont-Laurier, province of Québec, Canada. Some aspects of human geography in a shielded Canadian sector'' [http://www.persee.fr/web/revues/home/prescript/article/jsa_0037-9174_1947_num_36_1_2352 Read online] {{Fr icon}} * 1950: ''Some observations on the Oyampi of Oyapock (French Guyana)'' [http://www.persee.fr/web/revues/home/prescript/article/jsa_0037-9174_1950_num_39_1_2382 Read online] {{Fr icon}} * 1953: ''The Southern Lands'', (Presse Universitaire de France) {{Fr icon}} * 1954: ''Two years on the Islands of Desolation'', [[éditions Julliard]], Coll. Sciences et Voyages, 316 pages {{Fr icon}} * 1957: ''Arid Brazil (Life in the catinga)'' Gallimard, coll. Géographie humaine 29, Paris, 274 pages, ill., 23 cm {{Fr icon}} * 1957: ''Tropics (Tropical nature)'', (with Jean-Paul Harroy and François Bourlière), Horizons de France, 206 pages {{Fr icon}} * 1958: ''Man and Volcanoes'' Gallimard, Coll. Géographie humaine 30, Paris, 398 pages - XVI p. of plates, ill., 23 cm {{Fr icon}}

[[Micronation]]s are ephemeral, self-proclaimed entities that claim to be independent sovereign states, but which are not acknowledged as such by any recognised sovereign state, or by any supranational organisation.
This article documents the designated [[national flag]]s of micronations whose existence is verifiable in multiple, non-trivial third party reference sources, which have been cited in the linked Wikipedia articles for those entities.
__NOTOC__ {{compact ToC|side=yes|top=yes|num=yes}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Florida Environmental Research Institute (FERI) | logo = <!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:Feri logo.gif|140px]] --> | type = Not-for-profit Research Institute | foundation = 1998 | founder = W. Paul Bissett | location_city = Tampa, FL | location_country = USA | homepage = [http://www.feriweb.org FERI's Home Page] }} The '''Florida Environmental Research Institute''' ('''FERI''') is a 501(c)3 not-for-profit, research and education organization<ref>{{cite news |title=Trading The World At A Price |url=http://www2.tbo.com/content/2008/feb/08/bz-trading-the-world-at-a-price/ |work=[[The Tampa Tribune]] |date=2008-02-08 |accessdate=2008-03-07 }}</ref> located in [[Tampa]], [[Florida]]. Founded in 1998, FERI’s initial client was the [[United States Department of Defense|Department of Defense]] (DoD) [[Office of Naval Research]] (ONR).<ref>{{cite journal |last=Trees |first=Charles C. |author2=Bissett, Paul W. |author3=Dierssen, Heidi |author4=Kohler,David D. R. |author5=Moline,Mark A. |author6=Mueller,James L. |author7=Pieper,Richard E. |author8=Twardowski,Michael S. |author9=Zaneveld, J. Ronald V. |year=2005 |title=Monitoring Water Transparency and Diver Visibility in Ports and Harbors Using Aircraft Hyperspectral Remote Sensing |journal=Proceedings of SPIE |volume=5780 |pages=91–98 |doi=10.1117/12.607554 |url=http://www.marine.calpoly.edu/PDF/Moline/2005.Trees.etal.watertransparency.pdf |accessdate=2008-03-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060914065828/http://www.marine.calpoly.edu/PDF/Moline/2005.Trees.etal.watertransparency.pdf |archivedate=2006-09-14 |df= }}</ref> It was ONR's funding that allowed for the development of the tools to rapidly assess the coastal ocean environment utilizing cutting edge environmental mapping and monitoring techniques, specifically [[hyperspectral]] [[remote sensing]].<ref>{{cite paper |last=Sandor-Leahy |first=Stephanie R. |title=Coastal waters imaging: instrument and data utility issues |publisher=[[American Meteorological Society]] |date=2007-01-17 |url=http://ams.confex.com/ams/87ANNUAL/techprogram/paper_119323.htm |accessdate=2008-03-07 }}</ref> Currently, FERI is responsible for a wide range of tasks spanning from the construction and aerial deployment<ref>{{cite news |title=SCIENTISTS HOPE VIEW FROM THE SKY IS TELLING |url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=SO&s_site=sanluisobispo&p_multi=SO&p_theme=realcities&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=10622FB025328589&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM |work=[[Monterey County Herald]] |date=2004-11-02 |accessdate=2008-03-07 }}</ref> of several digital sensor systems to the analysis of the data generated by these systems to produce informative and functional maps of U.S. coastal regions.
In 2003 the institute received part of a $4.2 million [[National Science Foundation]] grant for a study of pollution in the [[Hudson River]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Researchers to track Hudson River pollution into Atlantic |url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/science/2003-05-12-hudson-pollute_x.htm |work=[[USA Today]] |date=2003-12-05 |accessdate=2008-03-07 | first1=Todd B. | last1=Bates | first2=Asbury | last2=Park}}</ref>
In the Fall of 2006, FERI spun off a for profit project focused on the development of an online mapping portal called [[WeoGeo]].
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.feriweb.org FERI Official site]
[[Category:Research institutes in the United States]] [[Category:Remote sensing institutes]] [[Category:Geographical technology]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Tampa, Florida]] [[Category:Environmental research institutes]] [[Category:1998 establishments in Florida]]

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=March 2013}}
'''[[Geographic information system|Geographic Information Systems]] (GIS)''' are becoming an increasingly important component of business, healthcare, security, government, trade, media, transportation and tourism industries and operations in '''[[China]]''' and [[geographic information system|GIS software]] are playing an increasing role in the way [[list of companies of China|Chinese companies]] analyze and manage [[business operations]].
==History== When GIS first became widely available in the 1980s and 1990s, the only source of geographic data for China was paper maps. Several universities elected to undertake the huge task of [[digitization|digitizing]] this information so that other researchers could use it.
The two earliest projects were conducted by The Australian Consortium for the Asian Spatial Information and Analysis Network ([http://www.asian.gu.edu.au ACASIAN]) at [[Griffith University]] and the [http://chinadatacenter.org China Data Center] at the [[University of Michigan at Ann Arbor]]. ACASIAN specialized solely in spatial coverages while the China Data Center included GIS coverages as a supplemented to their primary mission of providing Chinese statistical and census data.
There is a great deal of high quality GIS data being produced in China by both government organizations and private companies. Today, China's National Spatial Data Infrastructure Project, uses the [[WGS84]] standard.
In 1991, China's first color Map Editing and Publication System, MapCAD.
In 1995, China's first National Advanced GIS Software, Computer based GIS, [[MapGIS]].
In 2005, The fourth generation of large scale distributed structure GIS, MapGIS 7.0
In 2009, China's GIS new ero—MapGIS K9.
==Geographic Names Information System== China in the early 1980s began studies for the establishment of its [[Geographic Names Information System]] (地名信息系统), Geographic Names Information System Research Laboratory and the establishment of the National Atlas of geographical names database research.
==Education== The [[China Association for Geographic Information System]]<ref>[http://www.cagis.org.cn/ 中国地理信息产业协会] {{zh icon}}</ref> ({{zh|s=中国地理信息产业协会|t=中國地理信息產業協會|p=zhōng guó dì lǐ xìn xī chǎn yè xié huì}}), [[Peking University]] and other institutes jointly sponsored the first "Innovation and Development, 2006 College GIS Forum", in [[Beijing]]. More than 300 experts and scholars attended the forum. Sessions involved China's geographic information system (GIS) research in multi-disciplinary fields, personnel training, and technology. China has now more than 500 institutions of higher learning training GIS-related professionals, of which more than 200 universities and colleges have established a GIS lab.<ref>[http://www.cdst.gov.cn/ReadNews.asp?NewsID=4969 我国200多所高校建立地理信息系统实验室] {{zh icon}}</ref>
==Industry== The GIS industry in China is worth 400 billion yuan per annum as of November 2007. More than 300,000 people were involved in either building or using these systems, according to Zondy Cyber Group president Wu Xincai, who is also the president of the China Association for Geographic Information System. Almost 20,000 enterprises are estimated to have engaged in the industry. The biggest vendor of GIS in China is Zondy Cyber Group, followed by SuperMap. Around 2000 of these have GIS as a core discipline or function. The industry's rapid expansion is attributed to the country's [[economic development]], which has led to an increase in capital input, from both government and businesses. Between 2001 and 2005 the [[Ministry of Information Industry]] allocated more than 20 million yuan to fund the development and application of GIS. GIS has been put to use in many spheres, including [[topographic surveying and mapping|land survey]], mineral exploitation, [[water conservancy]] and [[environmental protection]]. It also has applications in [[power generation]], [[map]]ping, [[telecommunication]], and the [[management]] of [[public administration]] and [[public services]].
==Notable persons== Prof. Chen Shupeng,<ref>[http://www.lreis.ac.cn/eng/lreis_ry/chensp.htm Prof. Chen Shupeng] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070111145610/http://www.lreis.ac.cn/eng/lreis_ry/chensp.htm |date=2007-01-11 }}</ref> born in 1920, is considered the founding father of Remote Sensing and GIS in China, died on 25 November 2008.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalearth-isde.org/news/539.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-12-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110522021520/http://www.digitalearth-isde.org/news/539.html |archivedate=2011-05-22 |df= }}</ref> Chen started the [https://web.archive.org/web/20080512023154/http://www.lreis.ac.cn/eng/index.htm State Key Laboratory of Resources and Environmental Information System] (LREIS) in 1987.
==Institutions== Major institutions include: {{div col|colwidth=30em}} * [http://ngcc.sbsm.gov.cn/ National Geographic Information System] (国家基础地理信息中心) * [https://web.archive.org/web/20081218162215/http://nfgis.nsdi.gov.cn/ National Fundamental Geographic Information System] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080828004328/http://ngcc.sbsm.gov.cn/English/about.asp National Geomatics Center of China] * [http://www.sbsm.gov.cn/ State Bureau of Surveying and Mapping] * [http://www.issas.ac.cn/ Institute of Soil Sciences], The [[Chinese Academy of Sciences]] * [http://www.geodata.cn/ The Data Sharing Network of Earth System Science] * [http://www.supermap.com.cn/ SuperMap] is a stand-alone GIS program and data provider. They have several large contracts with the Chinese government and are one of the few sources for 1:500 scale map data which they offer for a limited number of cities. * MapWorld provides 1:10,000 and 1:25,000 scale data on a range of topics from administrative boundaries to facilities management. They provide datum and projection information and prepare data in either ESRI or MapInfo formats. * [http://www.creation-bj.com Beijing Creation Science & Technology Development] specializes in personalized data sets at any scale. They also prepare and process satellite images. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080512023154/http://www.lreis.ac.cn/eng/index.htm State Key Laboratory of Resources and Environmental Information System (LREIS)] * [http://www.westgis.ac.cn/ Laboratory of Remote Sensing and Geospatial Science] * [http://www.cugb.edu.cn/ China University of Geosciences] [[China University of Geosciences]] {{div col end}}
== [[Satellite navigation|Global navigation satellite system]] == * [[BeiDou Navigation Satellite System]] is used for GIS data gathering
== See also == {{portal|China|Geography}} {{div col|colwidth=30em}} * [[Canada Geographic Information System]] * [[China Historical Geographic Information System]] * [[Geographic information system]] * [[Geoinformatics]] * [[Historical geographic information system]] * [[Information science]] * [[National Historical Geographic Information System]] {{div col end}}
== Notes == {{reflist}}
== References == * Jiang Jingtong, and Liu Ruomei, [http://www.cartesia.org/geodoc/icc2005/pdf/oral/TEMA6/Session%202/PROF.%20JIANG%20JINGTONG.pdf "China Profile Of The International Standard: Geographic Information – Metadata.”] Presented at ICC2005 – International Cartographic Conference, La Coruna, Spain, July 9–16, 2005. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070721001604/http://han.skinner.ucdavis.edu/techdocs/China.GIS.Data.Sources.html GIS DATA FOR CHINA] Michele Ladenson and Zhixiang Lu, University of Texas-Dallas, November 2006 * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110718220138/http://www.sbsm.gov.cn/pcgiap/tsukuba/seminar/paper_cn.pdf Recent Progress in China’s NSDI Development] * [http://www.cartesia.org/geodoc/isprs2004/comm4/papers/364.pdf On Developing Spatial Data Infrastructure of China] * [http://www.gisdevelopment.net/aars/acrs/1999/ts14/ts14581.asp The Exemplary Effect of GeoStar in the Spatial Data Infrastructure Construction in China] * [http://www.springerlink.com/content/n23jp5865rhvj768/ Framework and development of digital China ] * [http://www.gisdevelopment.net/aars/acrs/1990/Q/ps2005.asp Applications of Remote Sensing and Geographic Information System in China in China’s Land Survey, Evaluation and Administration] * [http://english.cas.ac.cn/english/news/detailnewsb.asp?InfoNo=27486 Leader of geographical information system studies in China]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * [http://cat.inist.fr/?aModele=afficheN&cpsidt=13625284 Development of geographic information systems (GIS) in China: An overview]
== External links == {{div col|colwidth=30em}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20081223152804/http://sms.webmap.cn/ China’s National Spatial Data Infrastructure Project] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080611060725/http://www.naturalresources.csdb.cn/ Chinese Natural Resources Database] * [http://sedac.ciesin.org/china/ China Dimensions Data Collection] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090207045125/http://www.uwm.edu/Library/AGSL/agsgis/dsdchina.html China Data, Digital Spatial Data] * [http://www.fas.harvard.edu/~chgis/data/dcw/ China DCW GIS data] * [http://www.gisforum.net/ Chinese Academy of Sciences Center for GIS Industry Development] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090614180038/http://www.cpgis.org/2006website/index.html International Association of Chinese Professionals in Geographic Information Sciences] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090819002715/http://www.hku.hk/cupem/asiagis/about.htm Asia GIS Association], [http://www.hkgisa.org.hk Hong Kong GIS Association] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20050914081533/http://www.gisall.com/ GIS Development Forum] {{div col end}}

93,030 km2 (35,920 mi²) |- style="vertical-align: top;" |'''Coastline''' |style="padding-right: 1em;" | 0 km (0 mi; landlocked) |- style="vertical-align: top;" |'''Borders''' |style="padding-right: 1em;" | 2,009 km (1,248 mi) |- style="vertical-align: top;" |'''Highest point''' |style="padding-right: 1em;" | [[Kékes]]
1,014 m |- style="vertical-align: top;" |'''Lowest point''' |style="padding-right: 1em;" | [[Tisza|Tisza River]]
